author: BrickbyBrickDFM
title: Great Read and Insightful!
review:
David Robertson provided excellent insight into how LEGO came back from the verge of bankruptcy, by going back to what they do best.  Which was going back to the roots of the brick and how it should be integrated into all play.  Their motto was only the best is good enough, which was created by Christiansen to encourage his employees to never skimp on quality, a value he believed in strongly.

The book takes an in-depth look into how the first two CEO outside the Christiansen family led the company. One taking a top-down approach and the other taking a collaborative approach to leadership.  

Along the way, you learn about the products that worked and the products that did not.  It was under Jørgen Vig Knudstorp's leadership when the company started seeking input from the community on products and this is when you see the growth of LEGO.  

This book provides lessons learned from a company that was on the verge of bankruptcy while giving you a history of LEGO and insight into the future of this worldwide company. This is a great read and insightful!
